body.p:
Cov Ky Dec 19/64
His Excellency Gov
Bramlette
Dear Sir.

I understand -- that Mr Henry Crout has proposed new evidence in the penal cases against him, I was one of the attys and hence state that I thought at the time -- as good, true, law-abiding man as Mr Crout -- ought hardly to have been convicted upon the testimony. One Beazley -- was the standing witness that term of the Court and swept the city, but we could not then impeach him -- and for that reason Mr Crout -- is compelled to look to you. He is a very
exemplary law abiding man -- He spent a large Sum -- raised a company -- went up to be sworn in -- (Last Fall) with his company and was thrown out because of slight rupture -- thus losing all his time and several hundred dollars. He is deserving of your clemency
